entry.title: Rvm Rvmrc to [.]ruby-version
entry.content:
Last time I used rvm, about one year ago, the preferred method of ensuring a project had access to a specific ruby version and gemset was to put a .rvmrc file in the folder that specified the ruby version and gemset.

You can read about .rvmrc files and how to use them here: external-url: https://rvm.io/workflow/rvmrc

This time when I added this file to my project and entered into the directory in terminal I received the following message:

‘’‘ruby You are using ’.rvmrc’, it requires trusting, it is slower and it is not compatible with other ruby managers,

you can switch to ‘.ruby-version’ using ‘rvm rvmrc to [.]ruby-version’

or ignore this warning with ‘rvm rvmrc warning ignore /Users/Tom/rails_3_tutorial/.rvmrc’,

‘.rvmrc’ will continue to be the default project file in RVM 1 and RVM 2,

to ignore the warning for all files run ‘rvm rvmrc warning ignore all.rvmrcsâ€™.
